intro: Chamaesyce oranensis, commonly known as the Oran dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Chamaesyce oranensis is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
